item.title: Super Block sign
item.description: Super Block is an urban plan project to in Barcelona that tries to reduce the traffic in the city and increase the green area for more human centric environment. However this project is my contribution to a signage development by a graphist for a new Superblock emerging in Example neighborhood. The project was part of his bachelor thesis. I was consulting and assisting him from urban planner point of view to develop his project further.

item.title: Pumped4Mutek
item.description: This project was the outcome of a workshop in IED Barcelona interaction course. In this workshop the tutor team help student to design and develop an augmented reality experience for the digital art festival, Mutek. This installation had a physical part at the SVD store where we design and install a vinyl for the window of the shop. On this design we embed a QR code that take the user to the digital experience.

item.title: PreciousPlastic
item.description: There is no doubt that plastic pollution is one of our main issues to save the environment. It would be ignorant not to absorb the magnetite of this situation caused by plastic production and consumption. As a maker and designer, I feel responsible. This project is my approach to address this issue on a local scale. Through this document, I will go through my studies to understand the plastic recycling process and its history.

item.title: For Raam
item.description: This is an ongoing hobby inspired by an Artist named KingRaam. He started a podcast at the beginning of the pandemic and I create these graphics inspired by his stories and music. These works might end up on his merch that he started recently. Check his website if your interested. Befarma! Chax Hamegi. Avalin joint... Jas o Raam...

item.title: Kali Logo design
item.description: This project offered to me by a old friend who wanted to open a gift shop. Here you can see couple of my etudes for logo of his new brand.

item.title: Intro
item.description: Portfolio Here I am sharing my work samples. To make it more accessable I cluster them into following scopes. This does not mean that there is no connection between them. Urban Architecture Data visualization Devices Computational Design

item.title: PlanGo
item.description: PlanGo is a new way to interface with schedule planning. For many years we tend to plan our upcoming daily life to optimize our time and resources. This device tends to find the middle ground between 100% digital planning platform and paper base planning. Each of these has its advantage and disadvantages. For instance, Digital calendars are the best in synchronizing your time with colleges and across different devices. However, they are often complicated to work with it.

item.title: Spml5x
item.description: SPML is a project started in the future learning unit of Fablab Barcelona. It tends to make the CNC machine accessible for students and let them understand the functionality of cartesian base machines. Furthermore, it can help the students to fabricate small mold and PCB at home. The current project is a child version of the main project, which tries to add two extra axes to the machine and make five axes machine.

item.title: Q-City
item.description: Q-city is a new experience of park in a super-city. It is trying to reactivate park as a public space by adding layers of gamification to it. This physical game tied to a digital app, which provide citizens with extensive information about their activity. Moreover, it allow users to pair with each other for more public interaction inside this space. Along with this primary objective, the games designed to produce electricity as a byproduct as a source for the park.

item.title: New York Bike sharing system
item.description: Advisor : Diego , Areti Markopoulou External link Number of trips in days of month different season. Number of trips in hours of days in different season.

item.title: CovidMap
item.description: COVID Map is Live map visualization which demonstrates peoples feeling about the coronavirus outbreak. It is watching public tweets and tries to understand if they are positive or negative. In this manner, it uses vectorizing each word base on its dictionary. One of my discoveries from this map is the countries that have access restrictions to this social media like China and Iran. Also, the limitation of this system is that it can just understand English.

item.title: Bosc Nocturn
item.description: Bosc Nocturn (en. Light Forrest) is an interactive installation, which invites people to enjoy the play of light. While combining both audition and vision, visitors can interact and change the light movement by their input through the microphones. Their voice will be reflected in the space with different filters. Advisor: Luis Fraguada, Cristian Rizzuti Team: Abhishek Ajit Soman, Akshay Kumar Gopinath, Daniil Koshelyuk, Elliott Sinclair Santos, Fran√ßois Nour, Gabriele Liuda Jureviciute, Hari Krishna Gundu, Johan Jasser Salas Castro, Kammil Steven Carranza Vivas, Kavya Jose, Lars Erik Elseth, Marc Bou Assaf, Nikol Kirova, Umit Ceren Bayazitoglu, Vinay Khare Wei-Hong Wang, Yasmina El Helou

item.title: The Eye
item.description: The Eye is a single web platform which help the urban designer and decision maker to simulate and predict the impact of different urban planning scenarios. This platform uses real-time data through the computer algorithm and machine learning in order to transform the raw data to the knowledge about cities dynamic state. Furthermore, the project open up a new workflow for urban planning by providing a range of concussion that proposals will may cause.

item.title: Tpoint
item.description: T-point is an experience on how robot arm can sense and interact with human. In the first phase the robot has to be aware of its position in the environment. The next challenge is to recognize the user in the environment. Later on user can have live interaction with robot. Moreover by taking the control of the robot you will be able to compose sounds and lights. Advisor: Kunaljit Singh Chadha Special thanks to Ardeshir Talaei

item.title: Hexwood
item.description: This research project studies and analyses the performance of timber laminates with MUF (melamine urea-formaldehyde) resin and wood particles (sawdust). Timber laminates are pre-programmed by understanding its behavior through simulations with the help of computational tools. Advanced learning and using digital tools will always help to push boundaries for understanding a material better. Its properties to react with different materials, applied forces, physical attributes etc. is crucial to investigate in order to understand their behavior, especially while studying those of new composites.

item.title: Goodwood
item.description: Good wood is a new perspective to Recycling wood with the help of computational design and robotic fabrication. This project tries to present a process to target the scrap wood, which left from the construction as a base material to build a shelter. This approach gets advantages from computational tools and robotic fabrication to detect, match, and fabricate the elements of the shell. Advisor: Alexandre Dubor, Aldo Sollazzo, Raimund Krenm√ºller

item.title: Enclosing
item.description: Advisor: Mark Burry, Rodrigo Aguirre Team:Alberto Emil Holguin Martinez, Ardeshir Talaei, Johan Jasser Salas Castro, Madhurya Bayyapuneedi, Mohamed Ifthikar Noordeen External link Error: Under construction...

item.title: Silencer
item.description: This project aims to design and fabricate a 2*1.2 meter acoustic panel. For designing, an agent-based approach has been obtained to maximize the cavity in the solid material and trap the sound wave into itself. In the fabrication strategy, the double-side CNC milling approach with a 12mm flat bite has been applied Advisor: Alexandre Dubor, Raimund Krenm√ºller Team: Ardeshir Talaei, Tale Dotan, Andrea Sofia Champion External link

item.title: DeltaZ
item.description: Architecture is a discipline that forces mathematics to escape the theoretical realm and confront the tangible. With Islamic patterns - as a singular example of the integration of mathematics in design - the application in the world of craft, as ceramic tiles, results in the complex non-hierarchical superficial motives that ornament so many spaces of the Islamic world. Advisor: Edouard Cabay, Rodrigo Aguirre Team: Armin Badian, Bahar Bagheri, Negar Bisadi, Soroush Garivani, Reza Hesami Sarvenaz Hosseini, Aida Jahanshiri, Amir Javdan, Marjan Khaleghi, MohammadReza Mahjuri, Ghazal Rafalian, Nematollah Safari, Sarvin Sarabi, Oveis Shahnaee, Mandana Tanbakouei, Amirali Zinati.

item.title: Hyperloop
item.description: Hyperloop LA was experimentation on the minimal surfaces as an architectural geometry to contain a hyperloop station in Los Angeles. This study started by base component study and continued toward a parametric development of it. With the manipulation of the geometry regardless of the architectural function the capability of the component has been found. Based on this knowledge, a broad catalog of the component was produced, which was the foundation of the final design of the station.

item.title: Re-envisioning Candela
item.description: The agenda is to further push the fabrication of curved surfaces with composite materials. However this time, the design studies of the work will be shifted from pure mathematics to the work and legacy of Felix Candela which still features a good deal of math and geometry in his works. By ‚ÄòRe-Envisioning Candela‚Äô, the idea is to study the intricacy as well as technicality and methodology of his work and to push it towards further computational design of the shell/surface geometries.

item.title: GoDesign
item.description: Digital world and rise of modern computers have affected our life in various ways. Yet architecture is one of this fields that thrives on the digital phenomena to promote new perspectives in desing and fabrication through this age. However, current CAD tools and softwares are still far less than perfect in the way they interact with humans. Thus in a quest to develop more innate ways for human-computer interaction we came up with the idea of Glove Operation Design.
